title: 115_hr3077
content: The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" makes amendments to the Social Security Act, including changes to sections 202 and 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends sections of the Social Security Act related to exemptions from reductions based on entitlements to child's insurance benefits, suspension of aliens' benefits, and reductions in benefits based on maximum benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions related to penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings and taking into account earnings in determining benefit computation years. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions related to penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings and determining benefit computation years. Amendments include changes to provisions relating to rounding of benefits and defining income for purposes of SSI. The Social Security Act is amended to include penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings and determining benefit computation years. It also includes changes to provisions related to rounding of benefits and defining income for SSI. Additionally, the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to repeal deductions on account of work under the program. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove deductions for work under the program, effective for taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
